courses
Class TimeSlot

java.lang.Object
  courses.TimeSlot

public class TimeSlot
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a combination of Days and a duration of time when a Section can meet. TimeSlots are immutable.

Invariants:

  • getDays() != null
  • !getDays().isEmpty()
  • getStart() != null
  • getEnd() != null

Version:
May 19, 2011: Class created, accessors and overlaps fully documented and implemented.
Author:
Jonathan Caddey

Method Detail

overlaps

public boolean overlaps(TimeSlot the_other,
                        int the_transit_time)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Determines whether a given TimeSlot meets at any time that overlaps with this TimeSlot, within transit_time. Two TimeSlots overlap if it would be impossible for a person to do something at one TimeSlot, wait the_transit_time, and then do something at another TimeSlot. It is necessary for two TimeSlots to share at least one day in common for them to overlap. If the TimeSlots have a Day in common, and the duration of time they meet on that day is not separated by at least the_transit_time, they overlap.

Parameters:
the_other - the TimeSlot to compare to.
the_transit_time - the time, in minutes, necessary to wait between durations of time. If the time is more than an hour, simply use more than 60 minutes.
Returns:
whether this overlaps with the given TimeSlot.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the_time_slot is null or the_transit_time is negative.
